intro: Erigeron nevadincola, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly in the Sierra Nevada mountain range. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Erigeron nevadincola is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine regions.
